page.title: 10A FARMER'S YEAR (2)
page.content: MAY:In May you let the cattle out to graze for the summer because it is too hot in the sheds.Also you have to drench the cattle which means you give them a kind of medicine which stops them from getting bugs and worms which grow inside them.You have to clean out the sheds where the cattle have been staying over the winter.You have to make silage for feeding the cattle in the winter.You cut the grass and put it in a heap and leave it to rot then feed it to the cattle in the winter. JUNE:Shear and dip the sheep in disinfectant to stop them having bots and maggots. The wool goes to market. JULY:Make the hay by cutting the long grass and leaving it to dry.Then bale it and stack it in sheds. Also drench the sheep and cattle for worms.
